summary: Email correspondence between Sigrid McCawley and an Assistant U.S. Attorney regarding the DOJ Office of Professional Responsibility's separate investigation into the original Epstein plea deal. The AUSA provides a heads-up that OPR may contact McCawley about victims' experiences during the initial investigation.

persons.name: Sigrid McCawley
persons.role: Partner at Boies Schiller Flexner LLP
persons.context: Attorney representing Epstein victims, receiving a heads-up from an AUSA about potential contact from the DOJ Office of Professional Responsibility regarding their investigation into the original plea deal.

persons.name: Assistant U.S. Attorney Southern District of New York
persons.context: Sender of the email providing a heads-up to Sigrid McCawley about the separate DOJ OPR investigation that may contact her regarding victim experiences from the initial Epstein investigation.

connections.person2: Assistant U.S. Attorney Southern District of New York
connections.description: The AUSA is communicating professionally with McCawley to inform her about a separate DOJ investigation that may contact her regarding her clients.
McCawley represents victims of Jeffrey Epstein, placing her in an opposing legal role to Epstein and his defense.

events.title: Florida investigation into Epstein
events.description: The initial investigation into Jeffrey Epstein referenced in the email, which McCawley asks if the 'initial investigation' refers to.

events.title: DOJ OPR investigation into Epstein plea deal
events.description: The Department of Justice Office of Professional Responsibility is conducting its own investigation into the circumstances of the original Epstein plea deal, separate from the AUSA's office.

keyFacts: The DOJ Office of Professional Responsibility (OPR) was conducting a separate investigation into the original Jeffrey Epstein plea deal as of April 2020.
The AUSA from SDNY gave a heads-up to victim attorney Sigrid McCawley that OPR might contact her to ask 'very brief and limited questions about victims' experiences' during the initial investigation.
The 'initial investigation' referenced is confirmed by McCawley's question to be the Florida investigation from 2006.
The communication shows coordination between different parts of the DOJ regarding victim contact during ongoing investigations into the Epstein case.
